data.name: Märzen
data.description: Brewers Collection

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

data.name: Marzen
data.description: This sweet, malty, caramel colored beer relies on traditional German lager yeast and two-thirds Munich Malt to produce its excellence. The flavor finishes dry in the true lager style and makes it an easy-drinker. A fan favorite only available twice a year in October and March. Anticipate and enjoy!

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Belle Isle Restaurant and Brewing Co
breweries.description: The Belle Isle Restaurant & Brewery, located in the heart of Northwest Oklahoma City, is a favorite for lunch, dinner and entertainment. Enjoy a menu of pastas, burgers, pizzas, and more. Then there's the Beer! We at the Belle Isle Brewery are proud to create the finest handcrafted beer available, using the best ingredients and strict German Brewing rules. We've developed an excellent selection of beers now available for take out. Our pub features a daily happy hour and live music.

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Smuttynose Brewing Company
breweries.description: Smuttynose was founded in 1994 by the folks who started the Northampton and Portsmouth Breweries. We brew a wide range of beers, from our year-round beers: Finestkind IPA, Old Brown Dog, Robust Porter, Star Island Single and Shoals Pale Ale; our seasonals to The Big Beer Series & our rare Smuttlabs releases; we brew something for everyone in the 24 states where we sell beer. Smuttynose is excited to begin production in it's new state-of-the-art, energy-stingy brewery in early 2014.  Please come visit for a tour or a bite in our restaurant.

breweries.name: 4204 Main Street Brewing
breweries.description:
At 4204 Main Street Brewing Company we believe simple and amazing food and beer pairing is a staple in life and we wanted to share that. Our neighborhood restaurant and brewery is a place to meet, experience amazing food, carefully brewed local beer and to enjoy life. Whether you love food or you love beer you’ve come to the right place. We are here for the food and beer lovers just like us.
 
We have a unique atmosphere at Main Street and a menu that compliments our beers. From light and sweet to heavy and bitter, you can find a beer here that suits your taste. Come in and enjoy one of these locally crafted beers. Keep coming back to find out about our latest beers and menu items.
 
Our outside patio is dog friendly!

Our small size allows BIER to have the utmost control over the many different variables that go into brewing a batch of beer.

data.name: Märzen
data.description:
In former times the Brauordnung ("brewing ordinance") decreed, that brewing was allowed only from Michaelmas (29. September) to George (23. April). To bridge the resulting gap, brewers made a special beer, which was longer durable: The Märzen.
Some more hop and stronger boiling of the brew helped to cover the summer times. And we do the same now.

data.name: Marzen
data.description: A German style amber Lager also known as Oktoberfest. Deep orange in color with a medium body. Smooth, clean, rather rich and slightly toast, with a depth of malt character. Brewed with 2-Row Malt, Pilsner Malt, Vienna Malt and Dark Munich Malt. Hopped with Tettnang and Hallertau hops and German lager yeast. Marzen is a Seasonal and contains 4.9% ABV.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: Kirkwood Station Brewing Company
breweries.description: Kirkwood Station Restaurant and Brewing Co. is located just a block north of the historic train station in beautiful downtown Kirkwood Missouri, a southwest suburb of St. Louis. Established in 2009, we are building a tradition of taste, quality, service and charm. With our award winning craft beer, exceptional food, and fabulous live music, the focus is on our guests and great times! Sit back with friends and enjoy the wonderful food and craft beer as you play billiards, throw darts, watch the game, or dance the night away. Whether it’s a small gathering or a party of 275 guests, Kirkwood Station wants you to enjoy the ride.

data.name: Marzen
data.description: Märzen, the German word for "March" was historically the last beer brewed in the spring. Traditionally, Märzenbier is a pale lager that originated in Bavaria before the 16th century and was consumed throughout Oktoberfest at the end of September. Our Märzen is a vibrant orange color. You will get caramel and biscuit aromas leading to a malty, mellow, and mild taste. Enjoy this seasonal while it lasts.

style.name: German-Style Oktoberfest / Wiesen (Meadow)

Please come visit us at our tasting room with food provided by Juliana's in the Village.

You can also buy six-packs, cases, and kegs to go.

data.name: Marzen
data.description: Marzen is Lock 27 Brewing’s traditional style Oktoberfest Ale. Brewed with Vienna & Munich malts exclusively and with German hop additions, Marzen is as German as they come. Full bodied and heftily malty this beer is perfect for nights spent around the campfire. Let Marzen become part of your fall traditions.

breweries.name: Lock 27 Brewing
breweries.description:
Our Mission.
Craft.  This single word means a great deal to us at Lock 27 Brewing.  We use it daily to guide us in producing only the best for our customers.  To us, it's more than just a label.  It's about the quality of the ingredients and the care we take to prepare them.  It's about the creative thought process.  It's about seeing rules as suggestions.  Whether it's our in house premium craft beers, or the fresh dishes prepared in our eclectic kitchen, we strive to provide everyone we encounter with a true craft experience.

breweries.name: Moody Ales
breweries.description:
At Moody Ales, we make Craft Beers for every day drinking. Beers you'll want to have more than one of. Quality, balanced, flavourful Craft Beers - brewed by hand on Brewer's Row in Port Moody, BC by our amazing team.

Dan and I started Moody Ales to share our passion for Craft Beer with as many people as we could. We opened our doors in 2014 after spending the summer building our brewery with our own hands. Our passion for Craft Beer got us going, sharing that passion for Craft Beer with others keeps us going.

- Adam

data.name: Marzën
data.description: German Spring Lager aged to perfection brewed with 2 Row Barley, Crystal, Victory and Munich Malts. Has an amber complexion with caramel and roasted characteristics and a fairly dry finish. This higher gravity lager is named after the month of March when most brewers made this beer.

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. breweries.name: Big E Ales
breweries.description: Our unique, cozy and family-friendly brewpub is tucked away in a small industrial park in Lynnwood, WA. We have been at this location producing our handcrafted ales since 2005. We take pride in serving our patrons more than just a quick beer or a bite to eat; we want to build friendships that go beyond the bar. Beer to us is something that bonds and brings people together from all walks of life. We specialize in transforming your events and parties either at our brewery or your home into an impressive beer experience. Our dispensing systems are not only innovative and efficient, they will enhance your party and will impress your guests…they will be talking about the amazing beer and the cool “party pig” long after your party. Over the past 5 years we have grown from a small production brewery with a tasting room into a neighborhood hangout. Come in and enjoy one of our handcrafted beverages in our cedar lined pub or out in our beer garden, oh and don’t forget to order our Big “E” Signature Reuben. Next time you are faced with a “Beer Emergency” either personal or with your friends come down to the Big “E” and we will help bail you out.

breweries.name: Trinity Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Always fresh, always crisp.
Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.

The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.

Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.
If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!

Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.

data.name: Märzen
data.description:
Moderate-intense malt aromas leave a rich, toasty character. Finishes dry and crisply, with malt richness and hop bitterness. Moderate Strength lager with a soft, smooth maltiness and moderate bitterness finishing relatively dry.

MALTS: 2-Row, Vienna, Munich Light, Munich Dark, Biscuit, Crystal 70, Carafoam
HOPS: Magnum, Sterling, Tradition

data.name: Märzen
data.description: Märzen (Mayrt-zen) was historically brewed in Bavaria from March through the end of October. It was brewed dark and strong, using dark roasted Munich and caramelized Munich malt to help cover up flavor changes from the lack of refrigeration (ice in those days) used to keep the beers cold in the cellars during the warm summer months. It was also the beer served at the Original Oktoberfest celebration, which originated as a wedding reception for the King Ludwig I and Maria Theresa. Bavaria was a very poor country and had little cause for celebration, so the King and Queen invited the entire population of Bavaria to the reception. They showed up that year and every year thereafter, and the event evolved into the modern day Oktoberfest. Gordon Biersch Märzen accentuates the flavors of the dark roasted imported malted barley and exhibits a caramel malt aftertaste, while downplaying the hop level.

style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. breweries.name: Gordon Biersch Brewing
breweries.description: In 1997, Gordon Biersch opened a state-of-the-art brewery and bottling facility in San Jose, CA in order to begin bottling and distributing its famed, German-style beers. Today, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company is a brewing industry leader with 22 years of experience and counting. The microbrew trend continues to grow, and the company is actively expanding its distribution nationwide. Since 1998, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company has more than doubled its production, increasing its capacity to 3.1 million gallons of beer annually, making Gordon Biersch Brewing Company the largest brewery in the San Francisco Bay Area.

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Holler Brewing Co.
breweries.description: John and Kathryn Holler make a wide variety of fresh, delicious beers in small batches for Houston. Visit the tasting room to drink their beer fresh from the brewery tanks!

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Paducah Beer Werks
breweries.description: Located in the Old Greyhound bus stations. PBW offers 4 Main beers with seasonal additions along with brick oven pizza, wings and sandwiches.

style.name: German-Style Oktoberfest / Wiesen (Meadow)
style.description: Today's Oktoberfest beers are characterized by a medium body and light, golden color. Sweet maltiness is mild with an equalizing balance of clean, hop bitterness. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived. Similar or equal to Dortmunder/European-Style Export

data.name: Marzen
data.description: A smooth, amber lager comparable to an Oktoberfest, malty with a delicate hop aroma and balanced bitterness from Perle, Hallertau and Tettnang varieties.

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Anacortes Brewery
breweries.description: Our brewers focus on high quality ingredients, a carefully controlled process and delicate handling to provide one of the best beers you will find in the industry. We operate a seven barrel brewery designed and installed by Sound Brewing Systems of Seattle with vessels fabricated by Ripley Stainless in British Columbia. Our brewery features a cold room specially designed for lagering to provide our beers with a traditional character and complexity.

data.name: Marzen
data.description: The name says it all, you want German this is it.

style.name: American-Style Premium Lager
style.description: This style has low malt (and adjunct) sweetness, is medium bodied, and should contain no or a low percentage (less than 25%) of adjuncts. Color may be light straw to golden. Alcohol content and bitterness may also be greater. Hop aroma and flavor is low or negligible. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent. Note: Some beers marketed as "premium" (based on price) may not fit this definition.

breweries.name: Sullivan's Black Forest Brew Haus & Grill
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Sullivan's Black Forest Brew Haus & Grill

style.name: German-Style Oktoberfest / Wiesen (Meadow)
style.description: Today's Oktoberfest beers are characterized by a medium body and light, golden color. Sweet maltiness is mild with an equalizing balance of clean, hop bitterness. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived. Similar or equal to Dortmunder/European-Style Export

data.name: Marzen (Octoberfest)
data.description: Our take on the classic Marzen is made with all American malt from Wisconsin. Deep ruby red and a welcoming biscuit aroma sets up a malt bomb experience with a crisp finish just like you’d expect in the beer tent.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Lake Effect Brewing Company
breweries.description: Our name, Lake Effect, is inspired by the weather phenomenon we experience on the Great Lakes, most famous for creating legendary snow storms. The lake effect also produces longer growing seasons that yield some of the highest-quality grains, fruits and vegetables in the world. Most importantly, our central ingredient – the water – is from our great lake.

hops.name: Hallertauer (American)
hops.description: Small quantities of the true Hallertauer Mittelfr?her cultivar are grown in the United States. However, just as with other Hallertauer hop varieties, it can be difficult to know what exactly you are getting; Hallertauer Gold, Mount Hood, and Liberty, among others, are sometimes sold as "U.S. Hallertauer". Even the true Hallertauer Mittelfr?her is not considered to have a true noble hop quality when grown in the United States.

malt.name: Aromatic Malt
malt.description: Aromatic malt is a kilned barley malt used to give beer a strong, aggressive malt aroma and rich color.

characteristics.name: Aromatic
characteristics.description: Imparts an aromatic quality upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Malty
characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.

malt.name: Munich Malt
malt.description: Munich Malt has a malty sweet flavor characteristic and adds a reddish amber color to the beer. It has enough diastatic power to convert itself, but needs help from another malt, such as 2-row malt, to convert other grains.

characteristics.name: Malty
characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Sweet
characteristics.description: Imparts a sweet flavor upon the beer.

malt.name: Vienna Malt
malt.description: Vienna Malt is a kiln-dried barley malt darker than pale ale malt, but not as dark as Munich Malt. It imparts a golden to orange color and a distinctive toast or biscuit malt aroma to the beer.

data.name: Märzen Apfelwein
data.description: German malt, semi-sweet, caramel apple notes

breweries.name: C Squared Ciders
breweries.description: C Squared Ciders is a Denver based craft cidery, located in the thriving downtown RiNo arts district.  We create the highest quality ciders from the finest ingredients that appeal not only to ourselves, but to a range of craft beverage fans.  Craft is a great word to describe what we do at the cidery and one of the things we enjoy about our business. The name C Squared symbolizes our commitment to take cider making to the next level, in terms of both the mainstream acceptance of cider and what cider can become. To do this, we are combining our decades of craft brewing experience with cider and winemaking techniques to bring new flavors to the world of cider.

data.name: Marzen Attacks
data.description: It’s out of this world! This Märzen style beer is crafted in the true German style, with the highest-quality German malts, German hops, and fermented with a specialty German lager yeast. This craft beer is light amber in color, very malty in flavor, and features a crisp lager finish!

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Lena Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Lena Brewing Company, located on the outskirts of Lena, Illinois…west of Chicago, south of Madison, and far from ordinary. A place in the country where men are men, women are appreciated, and beer is brewed in earnest and drank with vigor.

Here, every beer has a story. Brewed with a respect for traditional ways while exploring new approaches, the art of brewing finds a wanting public here in the heartland.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Von Jakob Brewery
breweries.description:
As Von Jakob Vineyard, we have brought exceptional wines to the Southern Illinois area and beyond for over 15 years. Now, we are excited to introduce Von Jakob Brewery, complete with hand-crafted brews, made exclusively at our Orchard location in Alto Pass, Illinois.

Offering eight styles of beer ranging from our crisp, clean, lightly-hopped American Pilsner to our rich, dark Stout, you are sure to find a beer that delights your palate. Or, if you are having trouble choosing just one, we offer a flight of all eight delicious beers. We also have a great selection of domestic beers as well as premium beers from around the world for your enjoyment.

And for our wine enthusiasts out there, do not worry – our winery isn’t going anywhere. We just thought we would offer you a different libation of choice, should you want to explore it.

We sincerely thank you for your support over the years, and we welcome you to come and experience this next adventure with us!

data.name: Marzen Boogie
data.description: Slightly hoppy version of the German Style Märzen brewed with German and American Hops! Contains Zythos, Cascade, Hallertauer and Amarillo.

breweries.name: Friendship Brewing Company
breweries.description: Brewpub, with Benefits Bistro food partner, 25+ taps, cool chill vibe in a 100+ year old building full of historic brewery advertising, huge outdoor space that is dog friendly, private event spaces available, just minutes off of I-70.  "FRIENDS MAKING BEER, BEER MAKING FRIENDS", cheers!

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. breweries.name: Switchback Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in Burlington, Vermont, Switchback Brewing Company was founded in 2002 by a formally trained master brewer and his friend, the vision was to concentrate limited resources into making just a few beers to achieve the highest quality possible. The success of Switchback Ale beer has driven constant expansion for over 7 years and made the release of three Rotating Specials, Roasted Red Ale, Porter, and Slow-Fermented Brown Ale possible. Thank you for your support!

As in the beginning, Switchback continues to rely on word of mouth to increase sales, which have expanded into New York, New Hampshire, and Southern Maine. Switchback now brews several thousand barrels of beer each year, but its beer is only available on draught or in 1/2 and 1/6 barrel size kegs.

style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Lumina Brewing Company
breweries.description: Lumina Brewing Company is dedicated to producing beer in small batches. We brew our beer right on premises. All of our beer is fresh with no preservatives. We specialize in brewing German and Bohemian Style Beer. We brew our European Style beer in accordance with the Bavarian Brewing Tradition of “Reinheitsgebot”, the German beer purity law of 1516. This means that nothing is added to the beer except yeast, hops, water and grain. All of our Bavarian Style Beer contains malt and hops from Germany. Our Brew masters have extensively traveled Germany and the Czech Republic and have visited many breweries to learn the art of old world style brewing.

data.name: Marzen Keller
data.description: Dark-amber Keller-style beer. This beer is an unfiltered and unpasteurized lager whose style dates back to at least the Middle Ages. Historically the beer is brewed in March, hence the name, but this beer is available for you now!

style.name: Kellerbier (Cellar beer) or Zwickelbier - Lager
style.description: Traditional Version of Kellerbier: Unfiltered lagered versions of Germanic lager styles of beer such as Münchner-Style Helles and Dunkel, Dortmunder/European-Style Export, Bohemian-style Pilsener and German-style Pilsener. Kellerbier is noticeably less carbonated. Subtle or low levels of esters may be apparent. This is an unfiltered beer but it may be naturally clear due to settling of yeast during aging. They may or may not be clear. Exhibiting a small amount of yeast haze in the appearance is acceptable. Low to moderately low levels of yeast-generated sulfur compounds in aroma and flavor should be apparent, and low levels of acetaldehyde or other volatiles normally scrubbed during fermentation may or may not be apparent. The sulfur and acetaldehyde characters should contribute positively to the beer drinking experience. There should be no diacetyl detectable. Dry hopping is acceptable. Head retention may not be optimal. Contemporary Version of Kellerbier: Beers that are packaged or on draft which are unfiltered versions of other lager styles. These may share many attributes of traditional versions, but are generally fully carbonated, fully lagered, with full head retention and absent of acetaldehyde.

breweries.name: Jack's Abby Brewing
breweries.description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Olde Main Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Our Brewmaster Cory O'Neel joined us in the spring of 2016. Cory is a 26-year veteran brewer who specializes in brewing quality control and microbiology. He and his crew have revolutionized the beer at Olde Main. If you haven't had his beer yet, you are missing out. The original eight tap lines have been upgraded to 16 so Cory and his staff have plenty of room to play. Come taste the 'New' Olde Main!!

breweries.name: Church Street Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Church Street Brewing Company is bringing lagers and ales from around the world to Chicagoland. Using the finest malted barley and hops from North America, the UK, and Germany, there's something for every beer lover. Using traditional German brewing methods, Church Street will break new ground with beer-lovers by making an expansive range of both new and old beers and ales, pleasing all palates!

While we currently have several year-round beers, our tap rotation will continue to evolve, with special releases and seasonal brews. We love hearing from customers, so let us know what your favorite styles are — we might just try a batch!

data.name: Marzen Lager
data.description: Deep amber color, round malty, juicy, medium body

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Chuckanut Brewery
breweries.description: Chuckanut Brewery makes award winning European style lagers and ales. Chuckanut Brewery & Kitchen at 601 West Holly St, Bellingham, full service pub, was awarded the National Small Brewpub/Brewer of the Year 2009 and National Small Brewery/Brewer of the Year 2011 at the Great American Beer Festival (GABF). Chuckanut Brewery South Nut Tap Room in the heart of Skagit Valley, 11937 Higgins Airport Way, Burlington welcomes guests of all ages since 2016. Check out additional information about Chuckanut Brewery at http://www.chuckanutbrewery.com/

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Conquest Brewing Company
breweries.description: The first production brewery in Columbia, SC established after prohibition.

data.name: Marzen Madness
data.description: Marzen means “March” in German. This was the traditional time to begin brewing beer for Oktoberfest in Germany. Our Marzen is a traditional marzen style beer made with Munich malt and three kinds of hops. We suspect this may be one of the best beers you’ll ever drink. Just pure spring water, hops, malt and our special yeast makes this a finely crafted and high quality brew. The Marzen Madness was rated #1 Oktoberfest in the world as reported by Foxnews.com.

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Indian Wells Brewing Company
breweries.description: Proudly producing fine ales & lagers since 1995. One of California's favorite microbreweries!
